channel.title: Portforward problem with client/server
channel.description:
I didn't know where to put this... So if staff could move this too the proper area please do so :).
Theres a problem with my fortforwarding or no-ip is not working or something...
When I try to get on my server using the no-ip.org ip it doesn't log me in. I have everything right. And it still doesn't work.
My portforward is right. My paths and classpaths are right (I believe) and my no-ip is up. And the ip is right in the client thats on the thing. The host is up too. It has a check and everything..
Any ideas on how to fix it, so I can put it online?
Edit:
How do I change ip in a [PI] client... No gui or anything so is it the class68_sub15 or whatever?

item.title: Portforward problem with client/server
item.dc:creator: @valcombird valcombird
item.description:
@valcombird wrote:

[quote=“GerraOnline, post:3, topic:394544”]For the no-ip problem… Don’t you have to open ports for that also

For the PI ip changing… go into Client.java and search “server =”[/quote]

Yea I think you have to open ports with no-ip. And can’t your portforward with utorrent?

And ok thanks for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforward problem with client/server
item.dc:creator: @i_make_webclients_fo i make webclients for you
item.description:
@i_make_webclients_fo wrote:

What are you portforawding with and go to www.canyouseeme.com and it will tell you if your port is open properly
